qas.question: What event in the 1970s led more regions of North America to use DST?
What country joined Canada, the UK, and Ireland in continuing to observe Daylight Saving Time after the war?
Daylight Saving Time was used commonly during what war?
Along with North America, what continent was affected heavily by the 1970s energy crisis?

context: Broadly speaking, Daylight Saving Time was abandoned in the years after the war (with some notable exceptions including Canada, the UK, France, and <a1_0>Ireland<a1_0/> for example). However, it was brought back for periods of time in many different places during the following decades, and commonly during the <a2_0>Second World War<a2_0/>. It became widely adopted, particularly in North America and <a3_0>Europe<a3_0/> starting in the 1970s as a result of the 1970s <a0_0>energy crisis<a0_0/>.
